F7018A3AE7F44812B325893E519A5F1A.description: Discuss how music has changed according to values and beliefs of the time and place (e.g., treaty education outcome SI12 - investigate the values and beliefs of self, family, community, and society in relation to the importance of honouring the spirit and intent of treaties).

11652858DB1C4509B540C67C6E711BAB.description: Discuss examples of contemporary First Nations and Métis instrumentalists including how music has changed over time.

747673E6DE4448D9AD6FF56706FBA49B.description: Discuss the historical context of Indigenous music traditions (e.g., forced relocations, banning of traditional music in Saskatchewan and elsewhere).

9EDDDA9BD20142AD9E9DE72C5C3C048C.description: Investigate local protocols and traditional/natural laws related to creating and performing music (e.g., gifting of music, cultural appropriation).

07CC32F957F847FDB742FF67112A2C8A.description: Research and engage with Elders and local Métis and First Nations musicians and composers to discuss how music varies among communities and individuals.

FD65FD12FBAB4D25A6D7FA27AB1CD3D9.description: Examine how traditional and contemporary First Nations and Métis instrumental music has been preserved or changed over time

9BDC14E623BD45EA92611908CBA7689E.description: Design a well-rounded concert program and provide a rationale for choices (e.g., diversity of genres and styles).

D60E491A9BFF499BB7091448A723F22F.description: Analyze and discuss characteristics of high-quality repertoire representative of various worldviews (e.g., traditional wind band, gender and sexually diverse composers, Indigenous, self-published, young composers, variety of compositional techniques and devices).

D10D819F8DAB4C38BC753B40ACD4C40A.description: Analyze and determine the quality of repertoire based on criteria developed.

501082B3731148CC8E297DDA5F1820F0.description: Develop criteria to use in determining quality of repertoire.

BF680BD444BE4F8DB9386B06A9D37A0C.description: Examine and play repertoire that utilizes a variety of compositional techniques and devices.

A1A620C655ED494AB49E750A3647B766.description: Examine and play a range of repertoire (e.g., traditional wind band, composers of diverse genders, Indigenous, self-published, young composers, variety of genres and styles).

F754A145E5AE457A88E6CBF95EA53655.description: Connect composers’ personal experiences to the literature where appropriate.

79F310C6D3FD463BA5D135B1ABD82313.description: Study and perform wind band works composed by living composers (e.g., inclusive of Saskatchewan, Canadian, Indigenous, minority, gender and sexually diverse composers).

6F31059DFE1C4073841FE2DCFB302422.description: Examine the work of both established and historically under-represented composers (e.g., inclusive of Saskatchewan, Canadian, Indigenous, minority, gender and sexually diverse composers).

5B92CB224CF8421DA277AC05C91BE75F.description: Investigate diverse Canadian and international music literature including established and historically under-represented composers.

04684704390B4601A7FE3534AF63C04B.description: Explore how evolving technology and media have influenced and changed how music is created, produced, distributed and shared (e.g., instrument evolution, recording, printing press, online music sites).

4DDCB8D343204127BBD71A65568A200B.description: Develop an understanding of cultural appropriation in music and respect and follow related protocols.

23E67B17DE39428193A9A7B997D8083F.description: Discuss where the wind band fits in the spectrum of performance music.

D3D092FC1B064C1385DB7608FE635F09.description: Discover, practice and perform music from various time periods, decades, genres, styles and worldviews.

E15EA11FEE8B4E75B1F529042FBAE844.description: Research the historical, cultural and social contexts of composers’ works and share with others

E6548C790FCA49DB9079C13C190F8519.description: Compare music from diverse periods, worldviews or contexts (e.g., common themes such as nationalism, social movements, historical events such as revolutions).

A15B8A038D4F4578B36A26A45EFEBCB3.description: Internalize and convey the intent of the piece.

B3B2D128CC794FE5A0997293C228BC72.description: Analyze the historical, cultural and social contexts of repertoire.

4B094C8C89D04E37BF589871F02762E2.description: Cultural/Historical (CH) Goal: Students will investigate the content and aesthetics of the arts within cultural, historical and contemporary contexts and understand the connection between the arts and the human experience.

B790A606D0B24B39AA560EEA17B2A888.description: Apply attained knowledge to improve personal and ensemble performance.

236B1234C20C4246BD40374CC2A60DE4.description: Critique performance of others and provide feedback (e.g., What is going well? What could be improved?) using appropriate musical terminology.

7AE76B92D6D348D0833334543D9A599A.description: Create a list of specific criteria to use in assessing performances.

385A57AE2BB4483780704A364553FF5D.description: Listen and respond, independently, to musical expressions of self and others, conducting critical analysis using musical terminology.

4476821B0D4347219A07053E9D1A891E.description: Examine the role and impact of music in own lives (e.g., mental health, peer group relationships, social change) and recognize the value of music as a life-long source of enjoyment and personal fulfilment.

FB394FAA855940698D99FC923EB85E11.description: Research and describe the benefits of participating in diverse musical and other arts activities (e.g., community ensembles, drum groups, live performances, jams).

20190AF388404FC4832D04FF82C22A2B.description: Broaden musical experience and interests through active participation (e.g., trying different instruments, attending concerts, joining other ensembles).

E2D7A37F2AE4471FB18A273492A668F2.description: Extend understanding of First Nations and Métis music and cultures through dialogue with local Elders or Knowledge Keepers.

38B3ACF204A64019BE63532C87B41494.description: Engage with local, Saskatchewan and Canadian musicians, including Indigenous musicians, to expand learning opportunities.

18B413A6945B4D28B50CF3E8D413DADE.description: Explore and analyze the impact and role of music in own life and consider and plan for continuing engagement in music.

AF739CDC8EC549C48E261F0C98A08BBD.description: Describe the development of personal musical skills and knowledge.

47BFFB1F73984FB3844FBECD5D9BD245.description: Examine and recommend various solutions to common musical challenges and goals.

EBBC0EC9E7B84ADC9A2F930984B0198B.description: Identify main areas of focus for musical growth and set and monitor specific musical goals.

5C2067CCB4ED4D7E95ED286AF2176C66.description: Reflect on the input of others (e.g., peers, teacher, adjudicator).

EE7A37F61EF64295839E8E8987E5B1FE.description: Examine own musical expressions, in real time and/or using recording technology, in order to improve through critical self-reflection (e.g., create inquiry questions such as What can I do to get better? How could I change this performance, arrangement or composition?).

77641BCF545B4F598A2A6D50685FAF40.description: Incorporate, independently, constructive criticism and reflection on personal and group performance.

B906ECDAACA342BDAD36078152979261.description: Critical/Responsive (CR) Goal: Students will respond to artistic expressions of Saskatchewan, Canadian and international artists using critical thinking, research, creativity and collaborative inquiry.

0AE6249D3FFC4290B47A97EC004B1B79.description: Demonstrate leadership as a performer by modelling and/or offering assistance, ideas and guidance to other performers during rehearsal/practice.

BC72D5F485C84E77886E38FCD8D5B46C.description: Employ rehearsal techniques (e.g., making notes, respectfully providing and applying feedback, making and trying out musical decisions).

5D65B7E8CD7E454093CBC9E8C769A4DE.description: Demonstrate knowledge of the skills, attitudes and techniques necessary for ensemble performance.

760A4FE890CB4EE9A4FEC0A4EFF16EBC.description: Play in tune with good balance and tone and know the intonation tendencies of one’s instrument.

84E983EFBA964609B0552C09E8176F63.description: Individually attend to melodic phrasing, rhythmic accuracy and articulation in the preparation and performance of music.

8B7E538861954DD6B13937F9CC197087.description: Demonstrate the ability to perform specific tasks particular to the instrument in the ensemble.

6ABD5456D163413CB8F11B9FC31C513D.description: Respond to changes in function and role of sections within an ensemble.

71AFC5AA003B425FBCB15F8DE2597318.description: Apply complex skills, practices and techniques accurately and consistently during ensemble rehearsal and performance.

0DE4DFD8160E448ABF1D04A01EBF0C07.description: Use technology (e.g., recording or notation) to generate or complement musical material.

9249D6A7DCEA4795B2188EDFFF268AC5.description: Discuss legal and ethical arts practices when composing or arranging (e.g., copyright, plagiarism).

64B903BF012B439AB917A4C9623B3ED8.description: Articulate what musical, elements, techniques, tools, language and practices were used to create the composition.

2CC49B1797FF403EA1BF5ACCAF63DD04.description: Refine, finalize and share music creation.

DC4374B06AD84ED4846BE17BE8BC11DD.description: Experiment with diverse music elements, techniques, tools, language and practices.

2E6F2DD06FF8425BBFA2710F811C0DAB.description: Examine and brainstorm sources of inspiration for composition (e.g., motifs, riffs, music excerpts).

D62601F0DC6B4C07B08702EB2A9CCB9C.description: Compose a piece of music (e.g., solo, duet or ensemble).

3A45585ECC104F2F9695202A36A3304E.description: Compose a melody using traditional notation or other graphic representation.

41C01BD0F85C45A2A1D8348807BA10C0.description: Compose original music on or for band instruments.

593BABC6F7264B7FA8FD576091AB70C9.description: Make expressive choices in response to form and structure of the piece.

D72F3DFFD12A4350A9DA4BF4405B4BCA.description: Actualize the composer's intent of the piece including own and group's interpretations.

3119DF996A1A4A65851C3D0FE7F4DEC1.description: Demonstrate musical maturity (e.g., emotional expressiveness) in solo and ensemble performance.

ADB305230A20433880A14F8C648BD18E.description: Perform with flow, intent and precision as a unified ensemble (e.g., controlled movement of the music, character and quality of tone, continuity of phrasing and rhythm).

299DF4F46F6B4D2991679BB44C3A9B88.description: Apply expressive indications (e.g., dynamics) to playing.

67B80AB87B834B44800CD5F498271152.description: Make independent decisions when shaping phrases.

03F5C725940848AB905503208A7AE57C.description: Demonstrate ability to independently make expressive, interpretive and creative choices to communicate music.

E63DEC10078A48589233CAA3B400F8D3.description: Assess and refine music reading and writing abilities and set goals for growth.

6BBE9845A7EA4DAEA932C416ABF72C83.description: Apply non-standard notation (e.g., Aleatoric) to communicate increasingly complex musical ideas.

D9607AC1E420480C9BB7E95E09A3E666.description: Represent musical ideas of increased complexity using standard notation.

324200721EEA49F091F5B545AC96AD6C.description: Use critical thinking to revise, refine and share music through notation.

D9111BEDD939401C87C4E03F28F71EF1.description: Read and interpret, independently, standard written musical notation of increasing difficulty.

12A41C8C16694C4EB91AACD794280F52.description: Interpret and represent, independently, notation of increased complexity, including standard music notation, to expressively communicate ideas.

E8EA57296EAD4E7DA0FB4FC8ED3D68E9.description: Notate (e.g., traditional, non-traditional, graphic) melodic and rhythmic dictation accurately and with increasing complexity.

F993A7DA868B4361A839A4D1A1EAA1F5.description: Create and reproduce musical ideas accurately using call and response with increased complexity.

88AB41D8577A4CA6A558B5F150B681FB.description: Discern pitch variances (e.g., tuning, pitch accuracy, intonation) and independently make appropriate adjustments.

5D99CCB254CE45C994E6F1E0B8BAF730.description: Match musical nuances such as length of note, tone colour and articulations within instrument section and full band.

DD6D53278FA44EDFA28583C03997AC31.description: Demonstrate enhanced aural skills related to sectional, ensemble and personal playing.

70CF1EF34FED4DFB8B513EEB89F1D61E.description: Play batter percussion rudiments including: ratamacues, seven-stroke roll, double and triple paradiddle, paradiddle-diddle and flam accent.

3DDBC8E9DA79446F8A2690B19F4C1425.description: Play chromatic scales in ranges accessible to the student’s specific instrument.

2346A873302A4267A193E1969D2A730F.description: Play 12 major and related minor scales using multiple articulation and rhythmic patterns in ranges accessible to the student’s specific instrument.

076BBFF6E46C4EE38A24447FDDEAF1C1.description: Demonstrate fluency and proficiency in rudiments (i.e., batter percussion) and scales (i.e., wind instruments and mallet percussion) including: 12 major and related minor scales and chromatic scales.

D27D1407699B431DBBBC49FC738FE03A.description: Apply extended techniques (e.g., vibrato where appropriate, experiment with timbral shading, multiple tonguing).

2A6DABE82BF44C809E79EEA7C8CF75B2.description: Apply accurate articulations (e.g., placement of tongue, attack and release, lengths of notes).

FC4C71D1EDA8433BBC41A2F25230841E.description: Model endurance and flexibility in instrument-specific embouchure.

FED5124B64B04A378DE09A84384A2D11.description: Produce a resonant tone that reflects exemplars and aural study.

D23800549A024C4FA46101BF7795A4A5.description: Play with correct posture and hand and instrument position.

E3C395C278FB4B86A27E88737BD734EC.description: Employ efficient breathing and breath support.

EE7F63A3B1F04C73ACE30059D8264CCB.description: Demonstrate, consistently and independently, proper instrumental tone and technique.

017C7A34B6BD4D568955A1EEFA9A3777.description: Creative/Productive (CP) Goal: Students will inquire, create and communicate through dance, drama, music and visual art.
